content.description: Start from the belay platform, climb up to the 1st bolt is easy. Move left to a dihedral. Follow it till you can join the arête. Getting past the ledge is the 1st crux. It can done 2 ways - staying on arête - very thin crimps, or right of the arête  Continue up the short slab to an overhang, and move left on to the face. The 2nd crux is getting to the next bolt and good hold. Move around the arête to the face.
content.protection: 10 lead bolts to a 2 bolt anchor.
content.location:
Head to the area with Blazing Saddles route names, just right of

Mongo Like Crack

. Belay from a platform with 3 steps.

content.description: Start in the right side corner of the alcove. Near the top of the low-angle section is a loose cube of rock. While it moves, it could not be removed with a crowbar. Above the cube, stem your way up the steeper crux corner. At the top of the corner, left and right options are possible, and they are of similar difficulty.
content.protection:
A standard rack to a two bolt/chain anchor. Placements may not be obvious. The anchors are reachable by lowering from

Doc’s Holiday’s

anchor, or climbing across from

Black Bart’s

anchors.
content.location: This ascends the right corner of the alcove. Penstemon is not visible/shown in the beta photo.

content.description:
"Mongo Like Crack" is the thin corner just right of '

Candygram for Mongo

'. Start up the coarse, lichen covered slab below the corner. Find the small placement then clip the bolt to get to the base of the crack in the corner. Once at the corner (~5.8), follow it to the overhang. Slot several small pieces, then pull the face moves (5.10c) to gain the upper corner. Very nice!
content.protection:
1 bolt and a standard rack with an emphasis on smaller gear.

Protection at the crux is a good 1/2" to 3/8" crack:  Stopper or tiny cam.
content.location:
This is right of

Candygram for Mongo

.

Rap from the anchors.

content.description: Climb the grainy features just left of the overhangs in the alcove corner. There are two bolts at ~40 feet. To maintain the 5.9 grade, climb to the right of the bolts. Pulling the direct line is probably hard 10 or easy 11. Continue through the blocky overhangs (5), then the upper right-facing corners.
content.protection:
A standard rack, 2 lead bolts,

and a two bolt chain anchor

. Currently (Nov. 4, '21) there is only one bolt at the top. Hang a sling to the right of the anchor, or use the anchor's of a neighboring rout. A second anchor bolt will be placed ASAP.
content.location: Lili is the right most route in the 'Blazing Saddles' area. It starts just right of the trail switchback in the shady, left-facing alcove.

content.description: Start in the obvious chimney, and climb up the twenty foot ledge directly above. Follow the main crack most of the way up to the evergreen. The crack can be wet if there has been recent rain. The hand jam crack narrows as you go up to a second much smaller ledge. There are some small bushes and lots of lichen. Pull over the top with some moderate buckets and good footing, and watch the loose boulders near the tree. Anchor/ rap on the large tree right at the top. A sixty meter rope should reach for rap. WATCH FOR LOOSE ROCKS.
content.protection: All trad gear. It protects easily with a standard rack.
content.location: From the fence line, follow the cliff left to the first obvious corner with the large chimney.

content.description: Start in the center of the alcove. The difficulty increases as you reach and pass the central blob. The crux is between bolts 6 & 7. There is a final interesting move just below the anchor bolts.
content.protection: 10 bolts and a two bolt/chain anchor.
content.location: Doc's is the center bolted line in the alcove.

content.description:
From the top of the V-slot, climb the slab to the base of the crack/corner. The first 25 feet of the corner is fun 5.8 crack/corner climbing. The grade drops a bit closer to the roof.

At the roof, join

Mongo Likes Crack

, pull the 10c thin moves up into the hanging dihedral, and continue to the anchors.

A 10d bolted roof finish is also possible 4 feet left of corner. There is a separate anchor for this variation.
content.location:
This route is 50 yards up/left/West of where the Dines Cliff trail first reaches the cliff. It's a major, left-facing corner with a 6 foot roof, 70 feet.

Black Bart's

wave bolts mark the next climb west from the Mongos.

Descend using the two bolt rap anchor.

content.description:
Start up the right-facing corner formed by the huge, separated block and the wall. It's immediately left of

Black Bart

. The crux is high: use of a long reach to a sidepull a bit off-line to the left allows the route to go at 5.9. A more direct move straight up onto the headwall is probably 10a/b.
content.protection:
11 bolts to a shared anchor with

Black Bart

.
content.location:
It is left of

Black Bart

.

content.description: Start in the left corner of the alcove. Follow Bullwhip's sharp crack past the loose, rectangular block. It has a scary range of motion, but the crowbar could not remove it. At the top of the alcove, find the invisible bucket to move right under the little tree.
content.protection: A standard rack, there are sparse placements for the first ~10 feet (5.5), then pro anywhere you want in the crack. It has a two bolt/chain anchor. Please avoid slinging the tree near the top: there is a usable crack just behind it.
content.location:
It is on the left side of the alcove with

Doc's Holiday

&

Penstemon

. You can get to the anchor for a TR from

Doc's Holiday

.

content.description: Start up the ramps, and establish yourself on the vertical face. Several powerful moves pull you through to the easier middle. The upper left-facing corner feels overhung, but it goes more easily than the first part.
content.protection: 9 wave bolts + a 2 bolt anchor with chains.
content.location:
It is left of the

Mongos

.

content.description:
A two bolt anchor left of

Mongo

provides a TR anchor to work on the roof. Getting up to the roof between

Black Bart

and the Mongo cracks is steep face climbing on clean edges in the 5.10 range. Several starts are possible. It's not bolted for lead as it does not have 8 foot separation from Mongo &

Black Bart

.
content.location:
This is the face then roof left of

Mongo

& right of

Black Bart

.
